title: Gershwin After Lunch

venue.name: The Royal Scots Club Online
venue.description: Online streaming. Shows at this venue will only be available to watch online and not screened in the physical space.
venue.disabled_description: No wheelchair accessible toilet

description: Concerts include: Saxophonist Jonathan Radford and pianist Ashley Fripp perform with some brilliant arrangements of some of Gershwin's contemporaries, culminating with a show stopping performance of Rhapsody in Blue. Violinist Emily Sun and pianist Alexander Soares take up the Gershwin mantel with some virtuosic arrangements of some of Gershwin's most famous works including Fascinating Rhythm and Porgy and Bess.  for more details and information on these concerts, please head to www.rosl.org.uk/fringe.

title: Beethoven in the Evening

venue.name: The Royal Scots Club Online
venue.description: Online streaming. Shows at this venue will only be available to watch online and not screened in the physical space.
venue.disabled_description: No wheelchair accessible toilet

description: Roberto Ruisi (violin). Ljubica Stojanovic (piano). Our ROSL Recitals series has been a regular at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe for many years, and this year we are bringing the series to our Princess Alexandra Hall. Featuring 15 concerts over five days, we have a fantastic programme lined up featuring our ROSL AMC alumni, with amazing repertoire covering everything from Bach to Gershwin, there is something for everyone to enjoy. Full line-up: Messiaen: Thème et variations, Poulenc: Violin Sonata, FP 119 and Beethoven: Violin Sonata No.9 in A Major, Op. 47. "Kreutzer"

title: Kora in the Evening

venue.name: The Royal Scots Club Online
venue.description: Online streaming. Shows at this venue will only be available to watch online and not screened in the physical space.
venue.disabled_description: No wheelchair accessible toilet

description: Tunde Jegede (kora and cello). Our ROSL recitals series has been a regular at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe for many years, and this year we are bringing the series to our Princess Alexandra Hall. Featuring 15 concerts over five days, we have a fantastic programme lined up featuring our ROSL AMC alumni, with amazing repertoire covering everything from Bach to Gershwin, there is something for everyone to enjoy. Tunde will be performing from his new album, Moon Waters, on both the cello and the kora.

title: Simon & Garfunkel Through the Years

venue.name: theSpace @ Symposium Hall
venue.description: Another high calibre venue. A classy alternative to the Fringe norm, boasting the most comfortable seats in town! Wonderfully located in our 10-space hub adjacent to theSpaceTriplex and theSpace @ Surgeons Hall. A programme of music, a capella, theatre and comedy and a stylish prosecco bar and theatre tent in the adjacent tranquil garden. A must for all well-heeled Fringe goers.
venue.disabled_description: Staff available to assist, full access via lift facilities. Full venue site is accessible, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, On street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. Cobbled pavement
venue.cafe_description: Food and drink are available in theSpace theatre bar from Monday to Sunday between 10:00 - 23:00.

description: Critically acclaimed as one of the world's greatest tribute shows, Simon & Garfunkel Through the Years makes its return to the Edinburgh Fringe after selling out for six consecutive years and delighting audiences across the globe. Embark on a journey through the legendary songs and history of Simon & Garfunkel with this heartfelt, honest and breathtaking concert. Featuring exquisite vocal harmonies, this spectacular production brings to life all the hits such as The Sound of Silence, Mrs Robinson, The Boxer and the iconic Bridge Over Troubled Water.

title: Guru Dudu's Silent Disco Walking Tours

venue.name: Meeting Point: Bristo Square outside Reid Concert Hall
venue.description: Walking Tour Meeting Point.

performance_space.name: Meeting Point: Bristo Square outside Reid Concert Hall

description: The Guru Dudu team returns to Edinburgh with our hilarious and engaging tours. New starting point this year in Bistro Square. Daily tours of spontaneous flash mobs through the streets, interpretative dance around local landmarks, group singing and lots of fun interaction. Everyone wears headphones (supplied) and can hear the hilarious commentary and dance-mix of uplifting favourites from the 70s, 80s, 90s and 00s. Accessible for all ages and ability. Come prepared if raining. More info at www.gurududu.org/fringe. Warning: cheeks may hurt from smiling!

title: Ew Girl, You Nasty

venue.name: Laughing Horse @ Bar 50
venue.description: Located within the five-star Safestay Edinburgh Hostel, Bar 50 is a bar and restaurant offering free shows, drinks and tasty, locally sourced pub grub in laid-back, modern and stylish surroundings – and a rooftop terrace.
venue.disabled_description: Full venue site is accessible, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. There is level access via the Cowgate entrance
venue.cafe_description: A full selection of beers, wines and cocktails and traditional Scottish restaurant menu.

warnings: Audience participation, Contains distressing themes, Scenes of a sexual nature, Strong language/swearing
description: Take a gonzo dive into a world of sex dungeons, meth and so much more with New York City comedian, Katharyn Henson. This show is fun and tasteless and chronicles the life and times of Katharyn Henson, a woman with a penchant for hedonism that has the energy of Jackie O... with a drug problem. Described as hair-raising stand-up, you won't see many shows this scandalous, smutty and smart. 'This show is a blast. This woman is kicking some serious comedy ass' (Kate Copstick, Scotsman). @ewgirlyounasty

title: 2020 Re-Vision – Vladimir McTavish

description: A comedy review of the year that was cancelled from 'one of the finest acts on the Scottish comedy circuit' (Guardian). It was widely agreed that the world was f*cked in January 2020. Then we had a global pandemic. Biting satire, as seen on BBC Scotland's Comedy Underground. Sell-out in 2018 and 2019. Didn't sell out in 2020. Winner of Lifetime Achievement Award and Scottish Comedy Awards. 'Amiable yet strident swipes against the horrors in store' (Scotsman). 'Inspired comedy brilliance' (Australian Stage).

description: Feast on five of the tastiest up-and-coming comedians on the circuit in this stand-up comedy showcase including your award-winning host, Masai Graham (UK Pun Champion 2016). Showcasing a different line-up every day.

description: It's been a long time since we could go see live comedy, but it's back! Award-winning comic Ben Clover presents a different bill of top stand-ups each evening. Different acts every night.

title: Alex Kealy: Monopoly (Work in Progress)

venue.name: Pleasance Courtyard
venue.description: Celebrate the return of the Fringe at the Pleasance Courtyard! Featuring the legendary Cabaret Bar and our brand new covered outdoor venue, the Rear Courtyard - there’s something for everyone with comedy, theatre and children’s shows. Soak up the festival atmosphere all day with food trucks and our al-fresco Courtyard bar. ‘The centre of the cultural universe' (Scotsman).
venue.disabled_description: A full accessibility guide can be found at www.pleasance.co.uk. Customers with access requirements are encouraged to contact the venue in advance and to make themselves known to a member of the team upon arrival. Full venue site is accessible, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. The Pleasance Courtyard is located uphill when accessing the venue from Cowgate. The outdoor spaces of the venue are a mix of cobblestones and tarmacked surfaces
venue.cafe_description: Soak up the festival atmosphere with food trucks and our al-fresco Courtyard bar open all day. An at-seat bar service is available for Rear Courtyard performances and a 'grab and go' counter is available at the Cabaret Bar.

performance_space.name: Rear Courtyard
performance_space.age_limit: Under 16s accompanied by an adult may be on the premises until 00:00. 16-17 year olds until 01:00. Licensing restrictions may be subject to change.

description: 'Rising star of the British stand-up scene' (List). Alex Kealy presents a work-in-progress stand-up hour tackling Silicon Valley, advertising, addiction and monopolies with 'perfectly expressed gags' (Chortle.co.uk). A show about connection after a year without it. 'A storming show from the whimsical funnyman' (Sunday Times). Top 10 Jokes of Edinburgh 2019 (Guardian). 'A must-see at the Fringe' (BroadwayBaby.com). '5 Comedians To See If You Like James Acaster' (Edinburgh Evening News). 'Excellent… dynamite Interstellar routine which I wish I had written!' (Mark Kermode). 'This is clever comedy... internal damage from laughing so much' (Short Com).

title: Ireland's Full of Mullarkey

venue.name: Laughing Horse @ Bar 50
venue.description: Located within the five-star Safestay Edinburgh Hostel, Bar 50 is a bar and restaurant offering free shows, drinks and tasty, locally sourced pub grub in laid-back, modern and stylish surroundings – and a rooftop terrace.
venue.disabled_description: Full venue site is accessible, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. There is level access via the Cowgate entrance
venue.cafe_description: A full selection of beers, wines and cocktails and traditional Scottish restaurant menu.

warnings: Scenes of a sexual nature, Strong language/swearing
description: Eddie Mullarkey brings you on a hilarious, almost entirely honest and wild journey of growing up as a mama's boy in the west of Ireland, being a failed Catholic, and coming to terms with the old Irish tradition of repressing your feelings. Despite being strongly effected by Grand Theft Auto video games and their alarming absence of morals, poor Catholic Eddie badly wanted to believe in God and in God's plan. But alas, God had other plans for Eddie. Observational comedy mixed with storytelling. 'Brilliant talent' ***** (The International Comedy Club).

title: Isabelle Farah: Ellipsis

venue.name: Assembly Roxy
venue.description: Assembly Roxy is our year-round home, and is a beautifully converted former church in Edinburgh's Old Town with a spectacular Central theatre space which has hosted a selection of physically distanced music and theatre events throughout summer 2021. Roxy Central is equipped with a bar which offers table service.
venue.disabled_description: Limited access to some parts of venue site, Wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking, No on street blue badge parking, Assistance dogs welcome in all areas. Depends. Roxy Central, the box office and outside bar are all wheelchair accessible. Roxy Upstairs and Roxy Downstairs are not wheelchair accessible. Roxy is located on a cobbled street

description: Stand-up is the outlet that keeps you sane. The nature of the game is to turn everything into punchlines. But can you do it if you feel all-consuming sadness? 'In some ways I wanted my therapist to come and watch me to see how f*cking hilarious I am and in others I thought how odd it would be performing to someone who's seen so far behind my mask. Would he even find it funny or just sit there knowing what I was hiding?' Ellipsis explores grieving, authenticity and being funny.

title: Landing

venue.name: Pleasance Online
venue.description: The online venue for the Pleasance
venue.disabled_description: No wheelchair accessible toilet

description: Landing explores home, identity and belonging: What happens when you can't figure out where your home is? What's it like to never settle, when something inside drives you incessantly to keep seeking "your" place on Earth? What if you never arrive, but always keep setting out? What if there is no land that will claim you because you are so uprooted that you go where the wind blows you? And what if home is the blue of longing for the destinations you never arrive in?

description: I renamed the tour. Sticking with Same Again? felt a bit triggering after the year we've had. So it is now called Back from the Bed. Some of the material will be the same as I had always planned and some of it will be new because it will be difficult to avoid mentioning the last year in which millions of decent people tragically lost their lives to TikTok. 'Unquestionably the best observational comic of his generation' (Guardian).

Jake 'catalyses laughter that cannot be contained' (Fest) in his most honest show yet. As seen on Comedy Central and ITV. This is sure to be another 'solidly entertaining' (Scotsman) hour that proves why he 'could easily be a TV star' (BeyondTheJoke.co.uk) and why 'all the ingredients are there to make Jake Lambert a household name' (ITalkTelly.com).

title: I Feel Petty / As Yet Unlisted – A Work-in-Progress Double Bill

venue.name: Laughing Horse @ The Counting House
venue.description: The Counting House has been a free venue for over a decade, and is one of the largest free venues in Edinburgh, with six rooms of free Fringe shows every day from 10:00 to 02:30. There's a massive outdoor courtyard, four bars, food and drink plus a restaurant downstairs. What better place could you hang out during the Fringe?
venue.disabled_description: Limited access to some parts of venue site, No wheelchair accessible toilet, No reserved accessible parking
venue.cafe_description: Four bars with a wide range of beers, wines and spirits inside and outside the building. With Free Wi-Fi, a large outdoor seating area, and food and snacks available all day.

description: Vix Leyton, Welsh stand up and host of the Comedy Arcade podcast lives her life as a self-styled princess of petty. In this WIP, Vix ponders whether pettiness is a character flaw or actually a super power. With Kate Martin, a stand-up who was made in the South but born in the North. Kate's experience in mental health gives fuel to high-energy storytelling combined with razor-sharp observations of life's quirks through a queer lens. All hosted by legendary MC Rich Wilson.
artist: Neon Flamingo presents Vix Leyton and Kate Martin

title: Monkey Barrel Comedy presents The Chuck Wagon Chuckle with Dusty Rambusky featuring Project X

Scotland’s Best Venue 2020 Chortle Awards. Three time Scottish Comedy Awards winner. #1 in Edinburgh for Bars & Clubs and Concerts & Shows on TripAdvisor.

description: Monkey Barrel Comedy's alternative comedy night, Project X presents, all the way from Tennessee (US of America), The Chuck Wagon Chuckle with Dusty Rambusky! Join Dusty and his banjo-playing sidekick Corn, as they celebrate their love of country and western music as well as every cowboys favourite pass time – alternative comedy. Guaranteed to be more fun than a bucket of snakes in a stomping hole. Yee-haw!

title: Shaggers

venue.name: Laughing Horse @ The Free Sisters
venue.description: Edinburgh's premier party venue and the free mega-venue with five rooms of free shows running throughout the day and night, all located around a vibrant and buzzing courtyard in the middle of Cowgate. With a huge drinks selection, a wide bar menu and a courtyard full of street-food tents and cocktail huts. Shows run from 10am to 2am, with music through until 5am.

description: Shaggers returns for a one-off special bringing more hilarity with a line-up of comedians from around the Fringe performing their best material based around sex and relationships. 'A tour de force of laughter-filled mischievous comedy' ***** (Arts In Leicestershire). 'Some well-picked mischievous unburdened comedy' ***** (Voice Magazine, Brighton Fringe). 'Utterly hilarious' **** (West Australian, Fringe World Perth). 'Possibly the best value show at the festival... cannot recommend it enough' **** (Herald Sun, Melbourne International Comedy Festival).
artist: Nik Coppin Productions and Free Festival

title: Opening Night: Culture in a Time of Crisis

performance_space.name: The New York Times Theatre (in Sculpture Court)

description:
Who needs art when bombs are being dropped? Who needs culture when lives are being lost to poverty, disease, climate crisis and war? There's always a crisis somewhere on the planet, but this year it seems that devastating events have laid siege to a greater proportion of the world’s population than at any time in the past century. Yet even amid such troubled times, art continues to be made; songs to be sung; books to be written. Tonight’s event is an exploration of why we need creative output in times of crisis. Tonight’s host is Kirstin Innes, author of one of the most celebrated novels of 2020, Scabby Queen. She is joined in the theatre by interdisciplinary artist Tice Cin; novelist, poet and journalist Angus Peter Campbell, and singer-songwriter Zoe Graham. Our on-site guests are joined via live link by poet Amin Haddad and the acclaimed oud band Eskenderella who will perform from a studio in Cairo. Also speaking live about Culture in a Time of Crisis are writer, art historian and filmmaker Nana Oforiatta Ayim from Accra in Ghana; poet and Scots language advocate Len Pennie; writer and activist Nayrouz Qarmout live from Gaza; novelist, political scientist and women’s rights activist Elif Shafak live from London; and novelist Emily St John Mandel who will be appearing live from Brooklyn. Join them as they look at the power of creative ideas to uplift, to transport and to help us understand the embattled world around us. Across poetry, song, stories and polemics, this evening’s event is an introduction to the 2021 Book Festival and a defiant, unapologetic, jubilant celebration of the fact that in times of crisis we need culture more than ever.

This is a live event. If buying a ticket to watch the event in-person, some participants will be on stage in the venue, some will take part remotely from wherever they are in the world and you’ll see them on a large screen in the venue.

Read translations of Amin Haddad's poetry, performed tonight by Eskenderella. (.pdf)

description: The world’s angriest optimist returns for another bash at sorting out life’s inexplicable complications. Stand-up comedy for people who like to keep things simple. As seen on: Conan, SiriusXM, 800 Pound Gorilla Records and The Laughable Podcast (Guardian's '50 Funniest Podcasts of 2021'). The Best Shows of Edinburgh 2018 and 2019 (Guardian, Times and Telegraph). ‘He’s just fantastic’ (Frank Skinner). ‘Wickedly funny’ **** (Scotsman). ‘This brave and winning hour certainly pulls no punches’ **** (Times). Sunflower and Smile out now on 800 Pound Gorilla Records, available from www.garrettmillerick.com.

title: Steve Antony, Maureen Phillip & Alexandra Strick: Just Be Yourself
description:
‘You can... be brave, be beautiful, be clever, be strong...’ Follow the story of an independent and inspirational group of children as they grow up and discover what they want to be in You Can!, the wonderful new picture book from author Alexandra Strick and Steve Antony, illustrator of Please Mr Panda and Amazing. In this interactive event you’ll find out about the real-life children who inspired Alexandra and Steve to create their wonderfully diverse group of characters, then join in as sensory storyteller Maureen brings Alexandra’s words to life and Steve shows you how he created his amazing characters. A powerful and uplifting event suitable for everyone including those with disabilities. Many thanks to PAMIS for their help and support in creating this event.

This is a live event, with an author Q&A. If buying a ticket to watch the event in-person, some of the participants of this event will be on stage, and some will take part remotely and you’ll see them on a large screen in the venue.

title: Daniel Sloss: HUBRIS

venue.name: Festival Theatre
venue.description: Festival Theatre

description: Daniel’s 11th new show became the world’s first big post-pandemic live tour, selling over 40,000 tickets in Australia in April alone. His 2018-2019 global ground-breaking smash hit Daniel Sloss: X (UK: Vue Cinemas, USA: HBO) sold out 300 dates across 40 countries including Moscow’s arena (Russia’s biggest-ever English language comedy show). He has two Netflix specials DARK and Jigsaw (190 countries, 26 languages), and performed six New York solo off-Broadway seasons (10,000+ tickets). Guest: Kai Humphries. ‘Smouldering… deliciously dark stand-up. Brilliant!’ ***** (Mail On Sunday). ‘Dazzling wit… unstoppable’ (Daily Telegraph). ‘Dirty, sweet and clever’ (New York Times).
